metadata.Description: Heating and cooling systems are technologies used to control the temperature and humidity of indoor spaces for comfort and energy efficiency.

level 1.Description: Heating and cooling implements Energy Efficiency Policy to promote energy-saving practices in buildings.
Heating and cooling funds renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean energy sources.
Heating and cooling focuses on district heating systems to improve energy efficiency and reduce emissions.
Heating and cooling plays a crucial role in the sustainable energy transition.
Heating and cooling partners with energy service companies to provide energy-efficient solutions.
Heating and cooling contributes to climate change mitigation efforts through energy-efficient practices.
Heating and cooling monitors energy consumption to identify opportunities for improvement.
Heating and cooling targets energy efficiency improvements to reduce energy waste.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

subelement_relations.Description: Space heating is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It refers to the process of heating indoor spaces, such as residential or commercial buildings, to provide comfort and maintain a suitable temperature.

Water heating is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It involves the process of heating water for various purposes, such as domestic use, industrial processes, or space heating through radiant heating systems.

Air conditioning is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It refers to the process of controlling and regulating the temperature, humidity, and air quality of indoor spaces to provide comfort and improve the overall indoor environment.

Refrigeration is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It involves the process of cooling and preserving perishable items, such as food, beverages, or medical supplies, to prevent spoilage or degradation.

District heating is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It is a centralized system that provides heat to multiple buildings or areas through a network of insulated pipes, reducing individual energy consumption and promoting energy efficiency.
